Name: Kinshasa
Description: The capital and largest city of the DRC, a major political and economic hub.

Name: Bas-Uele
Description: A northern province known for its forests and wildlife.

Name: Haut-Uele
Description: A resource-rich province in the northeast.

Name: Ituri
Description: An eastern province with significant mining activities.

Name: Tshopo
Description: Home to the Congo River and Kisangani city.

Name: Haut-Lomami
Description: A central province known for agriculture and mining.

Name: Lomami
Description: A province with a strong agricultural sector.

Name: Kasai
Description: A diamond-rich province in the south-central region.

Name: Kasai-Central
Description: A politically significant province with historical importance.

Name: Kasai-Oriental
Description: An important mining and trade region.

Name: Sankuru
Description: A forested province with traditional communities.

Name: Maniema
Description: A remote region with natural resources.

Name: South Kivu
Description: An eastern province bordering Rwanda and Burundi.

Name: North Kivu
Description: A conflict-prone region with significant natural wealth.

Name: Tanganyika
Description: Located along Lake Tanganyika, known for fishing and mining.

Name: Haut-Katanga
Description: A major economic hub with mining and industry.

Name: Lualaba
Description: A leading province in copper and cobalt mining.

Name: Kwilu
Description: An agricultural province in the west.

Name: Kwango
Description: Known for livestock farming and small-scale agriculture.

Name: Mai-Ndombe
Description: A forested region with logging and fishing industries.

Name: Tshuapa
Description: A remote rainforest province with biodiversity.

Name: Mongala
Description: An agricultural province with river access.

Name: Nord-Ubangi
Description: A border region with the Central African Republic.

Name: Sud-Ubangi
Description: A riverine province with trade connections.

Name: Equateur
Description: A province dominated by rainforest and rivers.
